intro: Syrmatium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered syrmatium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Syrmatium micranthum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
